differences: Different diagram type: A is a three-tier system architecture diagram, B is a user authentication sequence/flow
Different primary components: A lists Client, Proxy, Backend (with Cache, Logs, Database), B lists User, Server, Database, Browser/Cookie, Session Token

Different relationships/flow: A shows horizontal connections between components (client -> proxy -> backend) while B shows a left-to-right/vertical timeline of message steps (credential submission, validation, token generation, redirect)
Labels and annotations differ: B includes numbered steps (1-5) and explicit message labels; A lacks stepwise messaging and instead notes caching/logging as components
Auxiliary elements differ: A highlights Cache and Logs as separate downstream elements; B highlights storing token in cookie and redirecting to dashboard
Color documentation differs: A uses Red/Blue/Green for client/proxy/backend; B uses Blue/Green/Orange/Gray for user/server/database/arrows
Reconstruction hints differ: A hints 'Proxy in the middle'; B hints server box larger and database shown as cylinder
Dimensions and level-of-detail differ: A is smaller (50x12) and focuses on structural tiers; B is larger (60x25) and details message flow and step labels
Missing/misplaced content: A's notes explicitly say authentication flow is completely missed; B documents authentication-specific elements that A omits (session token, cookie, redirect)
Overall semantic interpretation diverges: the two transcriptions represent different underlying visuals rather than two renditions of the same figure
